scenarioDescription:
The 24 Sex Exoplanetary System


Overview

24 Sex is a star with 1.54 times the mass of the Sun, and 4.9 times its radius. It is located 235.06 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

24 Sex is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 24 Sex system


24 Sex b

24 Sex b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory, in 2011-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.33 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 24 Sex b is 632.820 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 24 Sex b is 13.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 24 Sex b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


24 Sex c

24 Sex c was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory, in 2011-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 24 Sex c is 273.480 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 24 Sex c is 13.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 24 Sex c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 24 Sex, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Lick Observatory.
name: 24 Sex b and c - Eccentric Gas Giants
